THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION
ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE
FOLLOWING:

eee
2020/KER/175
Crl1.MC.No.8553 OF 2019 (H)
2
ORDER
Dated this the 6th day of January 2020

The petitioner is the sole accused in
Crime No.311/2003 of Vaikom Police Station, he
was absconding and a case against him is
presently pending as LP No.25/2015 on the file
of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court,
Vaikom, for having allegedly committed offence
punishable under Section 409 of the IPC.

2. The defacto complainant is the 2‚Äù
respondent, who has appeared through counsel
and filed an affidavit to the effect that the
matter has been amicably settled with the
petitioner and that he has no grievance against
him. A report has been called for from the
Investigating Officer through the senior Public
Prosecutor. The petitioner does not have any
criminal antecedents. The matter has been fully
and finally settled. There is a civil dispute

Beal
Bie anny
pe
2020/KER/175
Crl1.MC.No.8553 OF 2019 (H)
3
which also had been disposed of.
In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and
the entire proceedings in Crime No.311/2003 of
Vaikom Police Station, presently pending as
LP No.25/2015 on the file of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court, Vaikom, stands quashed
under Section 482 of the Cr.P.C and the accused
is discharged.
Sd/-
ASHOK MENON
JUDGE
